title: Open Redirect via url Parameter in /redirect Endpoint
vulnerability_information:
## Summary
The `/redirect` endpoint accepts a `url` parameter and performs a 302 redirect to the specified URL without any validation. This allows an attacker to craft links that appear to come from the trusted domain but redirect victims to malicious websites.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Navigate to the following URL:
   ```
   /redirect?url=https://evil.com
   ```
2. The server responds with HTTP 302 and Location header pointing to `https://evil.com`
3. The browser automatically follows the redirect to the attacker-controlled site

## Proof of Concept
```http
GET /redirect?url=https://evil.com HTTP/1.1
Host: target.com
```

Response:
```
HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Location: https://evil.com
```

The server blindly redirects to any URL provided in the parameter.

## Impact
- Phishing attacks using the trusted domain as a launchpad
- OAuth token theft if used in authentication flows
- Bypass of URL-based security filters that whitelist the trusted domain
